conversations.content: Take a bright-red apple and dip it in syrup. See how it shines and glistens, as though it has become a precious treasure.
From fruit to sweet, delicious, fantastical gemstone. All that munching and crunching makes eating it sound just as good as it tastes. Would you like to try a candy apple too?
This candy apple is to DIE for!
Hee hee. I'm glad you like it. Thank you for teaching us such an excellent recipe.
It was the least I could do. You're always helping out around the place. Wield your newfound power responsibly, eh? Ha ha.
You know, I think you make them even better than I do. You really bring out the apples' full potential. If they could talk, I'm sure they'd express their appreciation.
Well, since they can't, I'll do all the appreciating for 'em. With my face!
Please control your appetite, Luca. It is time for us to return home.
Yeah, yeah. Welp, thanks, old man! See ya again sometime!
Indeed. I look forward to your next visit.
We're baaaaack! Uh, what's goin' on in here?
It seems more lively than usual. Did something happen?
Well, of COURSE it is more lively. After all...
We are here to find new stands for Quinbell's summer festival!
Could you explain what that entails, Catherine?
Exactly what it sounds like. This summer, we've decided to ask everyone in the Halidom to run booths at our festival.
I am well aware of the myriad talents possessed by the people here, and the more personality our stands have, the more exciting the festival will be!
Anyone who wants to apply can check the requirements and talk to Natalie. She'll take it from there.
Don't dump all this on me! You're the one who has to set the dang things up.
Anyway, we're gonna do everything we can to help you guys, so let's get these applications rollin'!
Ooh, pick me! I wanna sell shaved ice!
I want a stand that's FULL OF JUSTICE!
Hold on, one at a time! Anyone who's applyin' for this thing, come line up over here.
That explains why everyone is so animated.
Hm... I wonder...
Hey, Cleo! Why don't you do a candied apple stand?
With the recipe we learned before?
Oooh, that's sure to be a smash. They're a staple of every festival.
What are the requirements to apply for a stand, Yaten?
You've gotta know what you're sellin', and you've gotta have at least three people workin' there.
A three-person staff... Understood.
I take it you're interested?
I am indeed. It sounds like it could be quite the fulfilling venture.
Hey, you want me to help out?
Would you? That would—actually, wait.
You're supposed to work at the orchard that day, aren't you?
HOLY CRAP! I completely forgot. Maaan, so much for scoring an all-you-can-eat pass on Cleo-brand candied apples...
Those are for the CUSTOMERS, Luca. You attend to your previous engagements.
Now, then... I must find some willing and able helpers among the Halidom populace.
*sigh* A complete and utter failure.
To think so many people have already agreed to help with other stands...
If only there was a pair who've yet to make any plans on the day of the festival.
(There she is!)
(Looks like she's all alone... This is my chance!)
Cleo!
Rodrigo!
Jakob?! Wait, if you're here, then that means...
We're both here for the same reason.
(We're both trying to ask Cleo out to the festival!)
Did the two of you need something? Wait... Two of you...
That's it! Are you two free on the day of the festival?
BWUH?
Y-yeah! Of course!
Me too! My schedule's wide open!
Oh, splendid! In that case, I have something I need to ask of you.
!!! (Is she gonna ask ME out instead?!)
Wh-what is it, Cleo?
I'd love nothing more, my dear boys... if you could help me run a food cart!
...A food cart.
Yes. As things are, I am short two pairs of hands and cannot run one alone.
O-oh... So that's all, huh? Didn't know you had an interest in that sorta thing.
You cook every day, and you still want to do it at a stand? Gosh, you're amazing.
Thank you. I am quite interested in restaurants, you see.
You are?
Yes. When I was a child, it was my dream to one day open my own eatery.
I do not dislike my current job, mind you; I merely thought running a food cart might cross an item off my bucket list.
So you wanted to be a restaurateur? That's kind of a surprise. Why'd you become a servant instead, then?
I had my reasons at the time.
I know it's a bit silly, thinking of childhood dreams after all this time. Yet, I now have a chance to make that dream come true, so I'd like to strive for it with all my might.
Cleo...
(If I decide to take this on, it'll mean I can't go on a date with Cleo. But...)
(She said this was her dream. How could I possibly refuse?!)
Okay. If you're in, then I'm in.
Me too. We're gonna make this food cart the one to beat!
Jakob... Rodrigo... Thank you so much!
The day of the festival Quinbell
The stand is up, our ingredients are ready, and my yukata has nary a wrinkle. Preparations are at last complete.
Let the candy apple-ing...commence!
*sigh*
There's nothing to do...
You said it. Why aren't we getting any customers?
I wonder. I suppose we'll have to take drastic measures.
Meaning?
We'll investigate the most popular stands! That way, we can figure out what they have that we don't.
Right... I need to find something definitive to help us break out of this slump.
Let's see... Oh, that stand seems to have quite the line. What is it for?
Welcome to the Harmonia Choir's stand, Harmunchia!
We have Mariti-shaped cotton candy and baby Mariti-shaped ice cream!
SQUEE! Everything is just so CUTE here! The sales girl, the cotton candy, EVERYTHING! I'll have the works, please!
Thanks for your patronage!
Got another cotton candy coming down the line for you, Pia.
Thank you, Elias!
(How are we going to compete with such wholesomeness?!)
I see... So we're up against Maritimus and the choir kids. Tough competition.
The cuteness was overwhelming. That must be what's drawing in all those customers.
At the very least, we could use a billboard to attract attention. With Harmunchia, Mariti is what makes them stand out.
Maybe we can give our sign a bit more... oomph?
There's an idea! A fancy sign should definitely drum up some business.
Our current one doesn't really pop. It's just the name of our stand. Maybe if we had a picture of a tasty apple on it?
Urk...
Something wrong?
W-well, as it so happens, we DO have a sign with a picture of an apple on it...
We do?! Then why aren't we using it?
Uh, it's... Well, maybe you should just see for yourself.
Oh...my...
(I knew Cleo wasn't much of an artist, but this is DIRE.)
(Yikes. I can't think of anything nice to say.)
Holy mackerel! Cleo, did YOU paint this?
Yes, I—wait, when did you get here, Fleur?!
I've never seen something so freaky and weird! This is a blazing ghost, right?
No... It's supposed to be an apple.
O-oh. Wow. It's real, uh...abstract.
Hey, Fleur?
We have a favor to ask of you.
And here's your neeeeew sign!
Whoa!
That apple looks so mouthwatering, I'd be tempted to lick the sign if I wasn't sure it'd taste like dried paint.
You really are as good as they say, Fleur. Thank you so much!
Now THIS is bound to bring some folks our way.
No. This is far from enough.
Oh, Francesca! Wait... Do you not have a stand you should be attending to?
Nope! Festivals are for schmoozing and making connections. I'm focusing on building my customer base today.
But yeah, way to go, Fleur. This is a fantastic billboard. However, there's one thing still missing.
You need a slogan!
Er... We do?
Duh! A snappy catchphrase is vital! You need something that'll really capture the hearts of any potential customers.
True. That WOULD be good for when we're trying to lure people over.
Right? Now, let's see... With your stand, I think we could do something like...
＂A flavor so good, it wowed the Founder King himself!＂ How's that sound?
Wha—
That's GREAT!
It is NOT! It is most disrespectful to use His Majesty's name in such a manner!
Okay, then... How about this: ＂Candy apples your taste buds can't resist!＂
Now THERE'S a slogan. Do the two of you have any suggestions?
Hmmm... Maybe something like... ＂The flavor of love＂? Er, not that I'm in love or anything!
How about... ＂Tubular, swell, funky-fresh, cosmopolitan candy apples sold here＂?
P-please, no more! I couldn't possibly embarrass myself like that.
Sounds like quitter talk to me. You're gonna NEED something with a big impact if you wanna make it big.
Show the people you've got something nobody else has. Now c'mon, keep the ideas rolling in!
(I-I don't know how much more of this I can take...)
Are we really going through with this?
You bet your butt we are. Now, go! Jakob, you're on sign duty! Rodrigo, get advertising!
Got it.
You can count on me!
Come try the pride of Grastaea's forests! These mouthwatering candy apples have captivated people from all throughout Alberia!
(I know this is to drum up attention, but... This feels deceptive. I'm so embarrassed.)
(Is this really going to get us any customers...? Oh!)
People all throughout Alberia?! That's a CRAZY amount of people! I've gotta try one of these things!
O-of course!
Thanks! Now for the taste test. *munch* Oh, geez... This is...
(I knew we couldn't possibly live up to that advertisement! I can just see how disappointed—)
This is, like, STUPID good! Oh my GOSH, they weren't kidding when they said these were captivating!
Wait, seriously? Are they really that good?
They certainly look appetizing. Could I have two, please?
R-right away! Thank you so much!
I'll have one too!
I can't believe it. The line's suddenly winding around the way. I'm shocked at how much a sign and a slogan can do.
Hey, marketing is great for drawing attention, but it's not worth squat if the product can't live up to your promises.
The whole reason people are lining up is because YOU'RE just that good.
Yeah, exactly.
Put simply, you're a candy apple virtuoso!
Thank you all. After being showered with such praise, I have a lot to live up to.
I'm going to work my tail off making the sweetest summer treats this land has ever seen!
One candy apple, please!
Three for me, please!
Coming right up!
Make a line, people! And no cutting!
Hey, guys? I'm glad you're doing so well, but could you do something about your line? It's blocking our stand.
Ah! So sorry about that!
We'll take care of the queue now. My deepest apologies for the troub—aaah!
Heh! Thanks for the dosh, babe!
H-hey!
THIEF! After her!
Wait, Rodrigo! Jakob! If you both go after her—
Excuse me! Is my order ready yet?
Oh, my apologies! It's just about up.
(As glad as I am to be so busy... How am I supposed to handle all these people by myself?)
WAAAAAH!
Goodness, what now?
*sob* Mommy... I can't find my mommy! WAAAAAAAH!
A lost child... Heavens, what do I do? I can't just ignore her.
Hey, is my order STILL not ready? I've been waiting forever, y'know.
I-I'm so sorry! It should only be a little—
WAAAAAAH!
(This is quickly spiraling out of control!)
We're back!
Sorry to keep you waiting. We managed to get the money back. Are you doing okay?
Jakob! Rodrigo! Sorry, but can you mind the stand for me?
I need to take this little girl to the security station.
*pant* *pant* I'm back... I didn't realize how far it was.
Cleo! Oh, thank goodness you're here.
Is everything all right?
We've almost sold out! We need to whip up some more product, and fast!
What?! But I made so many. How can we already be running out?
Never mind. I'll go prepare some more. You two, keep watching the stand.
Aren't you tired, Cleo? You should at least stop and drink some water.
I haven't the luxury to rest. We mustn't keep our customers waiting.
Hey, now. The afternoon sun is at its hottest right now, so you really shouldn't push yourself.
Really, I will be fine. I'll be back shortly.
(This should be enough. I need to get back quickly!)
(M-maybe I should have taken a break... I might be at my limit.)
You know you have a weak constitution, Cleo. Running a restaurant would be far too strenuous for you.
N-no... That's not true. I'm not as weak as I once was!
I don't have time to rest...no matter how tired I am! The customers need me.
Ack!
Eek!
Owie...
A-are you all right?
Yeah. Sorry for running into you, Miss.
Goodness, I should be the one apologizing. I wasn't watching where I was going. Are you hurt?
No, I'm okay. But your apples, they're...
Ah!
Cleo! You're back! Whoa, what happened? There's something all over your yukata.
I'm so sorry. I tripped on the way back to the stand, and...
All the candy apples are ruined...
What's up? Everything all right, Miss?
I... I cannot apologize enough.
I know you've all been waiting so long. But I've ruined this batch of apples...
It is all my fault. I... I can only offer my sincerest apologies!
Are you freakin' kidding me? So, what, we waited for nothin'? Waste of my damn time... *grumble*
Now, now. She was probably just in a hurry to get back to her customers.
Isn't that right, Miss? No need to be too hard on yourself for this.
...Thank you for your kind words.
Looks like all the customers are gone now, Cleo.
I'm so sorry. You two went out of your way to help me with the stand, and I just...
I let down so many people today. This has been an unmitigated disaster.
There are a lot of people at festivals. Just makes it that much easier for accidents to happen. Don't beat yourself up about it.
He's right. And we can always make more candy apples.
No. I'm closing down the stand.
What?
Those were the last apples I had. One cannot run a business without product.
Thank you both for helping me.
The festival is still ongoing, so please feel free to enjoy it.
What are you going to do?
I'll...think about it after I clean up here.
We can help you!
No, it is fine. It is not a difficult task. And more importantly...
I just want to be alone for a little while. I'm sorry.
Cleo...
The stand is all cleaned up. All that remains is to put up a closed sign.
That boisterous crowd from earlier feels like nothing but a dream now. It's so quiet.
I suppose all good things must come to an end.
I imagine I won't run into many people up on this hill. All the better.
My venture was over before it even started. I should have known it was impossible...
Cleo!
We finally...*pant*...found you!
Jakob? Rodrigo? Why are you here?
We couldn't possibly leave you while you were feeling so down.
You're too kind. But really, I will be okay. I've endured worse.
I just wasn't suited for this sort of work. That is why I gave up my dream of running my own restaurant.
You did mention that there was a reason you had to abandon the idea before.
Could you tell us what that reason is?
I...suppose so. You two were such a great help; it only seems right.
This happened a long time ago—long before I was even in His Majesty King Alberius's service...
As I said before, when I was young, my dream was to be a restaurateur. I had always loved to cook. However, my parents were against it.
You know you have a weak constitution, Cleo. Running a restaurant would be far too strenuous for you.
What would happen if you pushed yourself too hard and collapsed? You need to take care of yourself.
Some people are cut out for some jobs better than others. You will be much happier finding work that suits you.
Back then, I was sickly and frequently bedridden. It was only natural that my parents would worry, so at the time, I obliged them and relinquished my ambitions.
I had no idea...
So why did you wind up serving King Alberius?
It was an act of rebellion.
Even if I had to give up my dream of owning a restaurant, I still wanted to do something involving food.
That was when I heard the Halidom in the Mistholt was hiring waitstaff.
I thought it was the perfect opportunity. I went against my parents' wishes entirely and found myself living in the Halidom.
So you were originally hired as a server.
Yes. As a result, I was able to incorporate cooking into my job.
But I suppose the desire to run my own restaurant was still lingering in my heart.
It was so strong that when I heard they were recruiting for new stands at the festival, I jumped at the chance. But we all know how that worked out.
Some people truly aren't cut out for some lines of work. My parents' words ring truer now than I ever thought they would.
I don't know that I agree.
What?
Oh, uh! I'm not trying to say your parents are outright wrong or anything!
I just think it's a waste to so unequivocally state that someone is or isn't cut out for something.
I mean, I'm not sure exactly how to say this, but...people can grow, y'know?
I've done a little myself, even. I'm better at picking out presents for you now. Or at least, I'm trying to be.
Heh... Indeed, I have not received gifts of fiendmeat in some time now.
Because I learned that it doesn't make you happy!
As... As you know, I'm not good with words.
Before I came to the Halidom, I spoke even less than I do now.
But now? I can talk a little more about myself without completely panicking.
So I think...it's possible to overcome the things you aren't good at. I'm proof of that.
You don't have to give up on your dream just because you're ＂not cut out for it!＂
I believe that as long as you don't give up, your dreams can still come true someday.
Rodrigo... Jakob...
Hey, there you are, Cleo! I went to see you at the stand, but the sign said it was closed. I've been looking for you!
Luca?! Weren't you supposed to be helping out at the orchard? And with you is...
Hello there. Luca told me you had opened a candy apple store.
I was jonesing for one so bad, I finished work as fast as my noodle arms would let me!
And this guy's just as big a fan.
I take it you're all on break?
Actually, Luca—
Oh, I almost forgot! I've got a special delivery for ya of some more fresh apples. They're presents from our buddy here!
What...?
I apologize if it's an imposition, but I hope you will accept them.
Your candy apples were simply amazing. Given the occasion, I wanted as many people as possible to be able to try them.
Did you hear that, Cleo?
Now we can reopen the stand!
I can't believe it... I thought my dream was over.
Not even close. We're going to help you make it come true...together.
Your stand was a cut above the rest, so please... Don't give up on yourself.
You're right. I was looking for another reason to concede defeat, wasn't I?
＂Too sickly.＂ ＂Not enough stamina.＂ My parents weren't the only ones tying me down. I was tying MYSELF down too.
And even though I had so many regrets, I was about to make the same mistakes all over again.
Uh... This is a LOT of emotion for a weekday. What the heck was goin' on here before we got here?
Pay it no mind. More importantly, I need to thank you both.
I will make THE most magnificent candy apples out of these bright-red beauties!
Rodrigo? Jakob? Our stand is officially back in business!
Yes, ma'am!
Come try the pride of Grastaea's forests! These mouthwatering candy apples have captivated people from all throughout Alberia!
Uh-oh. Nobody is coming by...
We closed our stand down once already. It is only natural that people might be wary.
But I will not give up now. We just need to keep calling for customers.
Come one, come all, and try the pride of Grastaea's forests! These mouthwatering candy apples have captivated people from all throughout Alberia!
Step right up, friends! Come try the pride of Grastaea's forests! These mouthwatering candy apples have captivated people from all throughout Alberia!
(I'm being drowned out by other voices. I need to be louder and think of new pitches!)
Come try a candy apple so sweet, even a dragon couldn't resist!
Come try the pride of Grastaea's forests! Just one bite will be—*cough* *cough*
Cleo!
Are you okay?!
I-I'm fine. *cough* I am just getting a little hoarse.
But enough about me. We have to keep trying to attract customers. I'll go outside the stand.
You can't! Not with your voice like that!
Please, let me do this! I don't want to give up again!
Come try the pride...of Grastaea's forests! These mouthwatering candy apples... *cough*
You know you have a weak constitution, Cleo. Running a restaurant would be far too strenuous for you.
(I said I wasn't going to give up. And yet now...!)
C-come try the pride of Grastaea's forests! These mouthwatering candy apples have captivated people from all throughout Alberia!
Was that...Jakob?!
Let me handle the hawking. Please, Cleo, rest.
Jakob...
Here's some water.
You're too kind. Thank you very much.
I...I did it!
Er... Did what?
Oh, it's just... This is the first time you've thanked me right away for one of my gifts.
I'm so glad! I guess this means I've grown even more!
Rodrigo...
(That's right... I've grown too. I am not the sickly child I once was. I am even strong enough to fight now.)
(I have met friends who will support me. With them, I know I can overcome any obstacle.)
(I am not a girl who needs her parents to fuss over her anymore. I refuse to give up on myself again!)
*gulp* *gulp*
Do you want some more? I'll get you as much as you want. It's the first gift I've given you that made you happy!
A gift... Rodrigo, that's it!
Huh?
Jakob, come here! I am going to prepare some samples now. I want you to get the word out!
You're a genius, Cleo! People are bound to stop by when they hear we've got something nobody else has.
You can leave the advertising to us.
The samples are ready!
Come try the pride of Grastaea's forests! These mouthwatering candy apples have captivated people from all throughout Alberia!
Stop by now for a FREE sample! One bite, and you'll be in heaven!
Hold up. Hooold up. Did I just hear ＂free samples＂?
Yes! Please, try one!
*munch* Oh, this is DELECTABLE. The beast stirs, and she hungers for candy apples! One to go, please!
We appreciate your business!
(This plan was a huge success! All of our traffic is coming back.)
Oh, what a relief. I'm so glad you aren't closed.
Ma'am?
I so desperately wanted to try one of your apples, but by the time I got here, you'd shuttered the place.
I thought for sure I wouldn't get to have one, so I'm very glad you're back. Might I place an order?
Yes, of course!
Now to put up our closed sign...and that's that. We really did it.
We sure did! We sold completely out of the fresh batch Luca brought us!
And now... You know what's next, right, Rodrigo?
Of course. Even if we didn't get to have a festival date, there's still...
The pyroblossom show!
Whoever Cleo chooses, neither of us can begrudge the other for it! Got it?
Who is begrudging who for what, now?
C-Cleo! Are you all done cleaning up the kitchen?
I am. Thank you for tidying up the stand for me. Now, what were you two whispering about?
N-nothing! Nothing at all! Anyway, Cleo, listen.
W-we have something we want to talk to you about.
And what might that be?
Will you come watch the pyroblossoms with me?!
Sure.
O-oh... But wait...
Who are you going with?
What an odd question. You two were the ones who invited me.
So let's all go together!
Bwuh?!
Er... Have you changed your minds? Feeling exhausted from the day after all?
N-no...
I-I'm just...so fascinated by the pyroblossoms! Gosh, they're real beautiful, huh? Ha ha ha...
I am glad to hear that. And also... Thank you both so much for today.
Without you two, I would have given up on my dream all over again.
I never would have thought I'd bring it to fruition after all this time.
I'm happy for you. But...
I wonder if OUR dreams will ever come true.
I'm sure they will.
As long as you don't give up, they will never be out of reach. You were the ones who taught me that.
You're right. Jakob... I'm going to tell her.
I will too. I don't want you to outdo me in this.
Cleo!
I have feelings for—
Goodness! That pyroblossom was enormous. It really surprised me.
Sorry about that. What were we talking about?
Um... It's... Er...
Uh... We were just saying... Let's do our best to make each other's dreams come true!
Right, of course. I'll be cheering you on all the while. And if there's any way I can help, do let me know.
Y-yeah...
Thanks...
(Rodrigo...)
(I hear you. We've gotta do our best to tell her how we feel. If not today, then...someday.)
